Title: On the Last Battle of Zahedi

In the ivory dawn, sings a dirge so clear,
for Zahedi, silhouette against the haze.
The al-Quds flag, deep in weeping's tears,
hints of clandestine dances and secret plays.
A commander's toll in the echoing strife,
the scroll unwinds for one more name.
Yet, to the stars, each lost life,
casts a different, haunting same.
